title.narrative: US-China Climate Change Working Group's Initiative on Climate Change and Forests

description.narrative: To support the engagement of public and private institutions in order to reduce climate change impacts from forests and monitor the results of actions taken with associated Chinese counterparts. This program will be focused on facilitating communication on forest-related topic under the UNFCCC climate change negotiations, exchanging best practices around technical methods for measuring forest carbon, increasing understanding of mitigation and adaptation synergies, and sharing knowledge on how to reduce potential forest-related GHG emissions from overseas investments.

title.narrative: CCWG Initiative on Climate-Smart/Low-Carbon Cities and Zero Emission Vehicles

description.narrative: This initiative will further efforts of U.S. and Chinese cooperation with projects that advance clean energy technologies, reduce GHG emissions, and identify commercial opportunities for the U.S. clean energy industry. The two countries will also share city-level experiences on planning, policies, and use of technologies for sustainable, resilient, low-carbon growth. This initiative will also include demonstrations of new technologies for smart infrastructure for urbanization.

title.narrative: Transportation and Climate Change

description.narrative: To support activities and initiatives consistent with the U.S.-China Working Group to advance and deepen transportation climate change bilateral cooperation with China with the goal to encourage national and local government actions on congestion mitigation and vehicle efficiency or GHG emissions standards that catalyzes investment in congestion-reduction and emissions-reduction measures, and ultimately to reduce GHG emissions in the transportation sector in China.

title.narrative: Preservation of Ethnic Minority Manuscripts at Minzu University

description.narrative: To support the preservation of more than 2,000 manuscripts of 15 Chinese ethnic minorities at Minzu University in Beijing. Folk culture and ethnic minority traditions are fading rapidly due to urbanization, and many languages are endangered. This project involves the cleaning, conservation, and proper storage of ancient and historic manuscripts and the preservation of the written language and the ethnic traditions they document.

title.narrative: Conservation of Archeological Objects from the Mid-16th-Century Nan'ao Shipwreck of Guangdong Province

description.narrative: Objects from the Nanao shipwreck are of great value for the study of the maritime Silk Road, Chinese ceramics, shipbuilding during the Ming Dynasty, and foreign cultural exchanges. This project includes analysis, desalination, cleaning, and conservation of several objects for preservation and display.

title.narrative: Preservation of Traditional Kaifeng Zhuxianzhen New Year Woodcut Painting

description.narrative: Although Zhuxianzhen from Kaifeng is one of Chinas oldest woodcut painting traditions, few artists today observe the techniques for carving the blocks or using natural pigments. This project includes the compilation of standard Zhuxianzhen procedures and techniques and the documentation of old woodblocks and tools.
